body.text: This open source sample application is built using the [webex-node-bot-framework](https://github.com/webex/webex-bot-node-framework), which abstracts away some of the complexity of calling the Webex APIs. If you are planning on looking at this bot's source code, its helpful to have some background on this.  If you are just trying to get an overview of Buttons and Cards, you can jump to the next lesson.

This bot's [README](https://github.com/webex/webex-bot-node-framework/master/README.md) about how it works, but in a nutshell, the framework provides our app with a `bot` object each time our bot is added to a space.  The app logic can then call helper methods like `bot.say()` to send messages to the appropriate space.

For sending a card, our app can call `bot.sendCard()` and simply pass the card's JSON design, which could be copied directly from the designer, abstracting away the need to build a full `attachments` array. While this framework is a handy option for node.js developers, the lessons in this bot will primarily cover the pure API approach, while still calling out where this app's code might be slightly different.
